page.title: 14HENWICK STATION. PART ONE.
page.content: Although closed as a passenger station following the Beeching Report,with buildings & platforms demolished, passenger trains (no freight) still use the line to Hereford,Worcester Foregate Street/Birmingham or Worcester Shrub Hill/Oxford & London. There are 4 locomotive hauled trains & 40 ageing diesel multiple units per day.The manual Great Western Railway signal box is used for controlling semaphore signals & points;there is two way working on the track from Henwick to Worcester Foregate Street, with crossover & holding siding still at Henwick.The level crossing with electricaly operated lifting barriers, contributes to traffic congestion by restraing traffic flow;some motorists even occasionally stop on the track between the raised barriers!!
